question:
Match List I with List II and select the correct answer using the codes given below them :
List I List II
(Vectors) (Diseases)
A. Tsetse fly 1. Yellow fever
B. Aedes mosquito 2. Sleeping sickness
C. Water snail 3. Bilharzia
D. Sandflies 4. Typhoid
  5. Kala-azar
     A B C D
explanation:
• African trypanosomiasis is also known as sleeping sickness. It is a disease spread by an infected tsetse fly, found in rural areas of sub-Saharan Africa. Sleeping sickness is caused by two different parasites, Trypanosoma brucei rhodesiense and Trypanosoma brucei gambiense.
• Aedes aegypti is the yellow fever mosquito. It is a mosquito that can spread dengue fever, chikungunya, Zika fever, Mayaro and yellow fever viruses, and other disease agents. The mosquito can be recognized by white markings on its legs and a marking in the form of a lyre on the upper surface of its thorax.
• Schistosomiasis is also known as snail fever and bilharzias. It is a disease caused by parasitic flatworms called schistosomes or water snail.The urinary tract or the intestines may be infected. Symptoms include abdominal pain, diarrhea, bloody stool, or blood in the urine.
• Kala azar is caused by bites from female phlebotomine sandflies – the vector of the leishmania parasite. The sand flies feed on animals and humans for blood, which they need for developing their eggs.
